title.native: ガンダムビルドダイバーズRe:RISE 2nd Season

description: The second season of Gundam Build Divers Re:RISE.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Real Robot
tags.description: Prominently features mechanical designs loosely influenced by real-world robotics.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/富野由悠季) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yoshiyuki_Tomino)

Yoshiyuki Tomino is an anime creator best known for creating the Gundam anime franchise.

Began his career in 1963 with [Osamu Tezuka](https://anilist.co/staff/96938/)'s company, [Mushi Production](https://anilist.co/studio/68/), scripting and directing episodes of the first Japanese anime television series, [Astro Boy](https://anilist.co/anime/2747/). He later became one of the most important members of the anime studio [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/), going on to direct numerous anime through the '70s, '80s and '90s. He is perhaps best known for his transformation of the "Super Robot" mecha anime genre into the "Real Robot" genre with 1979's [Mobile Suit Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/80/), the first in the Gundam franchise.

Known for using numerous pseudonyms.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Website](http://www.yatate.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yatate_hajime) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/矢立肇) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hajime_Yatate)

Hajime Yatate is a collective pseudonym for [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/)'s staff.

__Genres:__ Rock (Alternative Rock), Anison

__[Website](http://www.penguinresearch.jp/) | [Profile (SonyMusic)](http://www.sonymusic.co.jp/artist/penguinresearch/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZPSPAvxS6Kb_gLe_HYi94g)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/PGR_info)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/4jiOvoNgxnEvdlBwrx6o28)__

__Biography:__
PENGUIN RESEARCH, alternatively abbreviated PGR, is a Japanese five-piece rock band under record labels ultraCeep (2016–), SME Records (2016–) and Sacra Music (2017–). They made their major debut in 2016 with the release of their first full single titled "[Joker ni Yoroshiku](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SnoDBlVBLh4)", which initially aired as an ending in [Durararax2 Ketsu](https://anilist.co/anime/20880/Durararax2-Ketsu/).

__Members:__
- [Youji Ikuta](https://anilist.co/staff/153560/) (生田鷹司) – vocalist
- [Shouta Horie](https://anilist.co/staff/156564) (堀江晶太) – bass guitarist and in-charge of lyrics and composition
- [John Kanda](https://anilist.co/staff/160031) (神田ジョン) – guitarist
- [Keita Shinbo](https://twitter.com/KeitaShinbo_PGR) (新保恵大) – drummer
- [Yosuke Shibazaki](https://twitter.com/yosuke_pgr) (柴﨑洋輔) – keyboardist

__[Website](https://spiraspica.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/spiraspica) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/spiraspica/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCcrVKHnn9O3z0Ao6sUPE7nA)__

__Formed:__ 2013
__Genres:__ J-POP, Rock (Pop Rock)

__Introduction:__
Spira Spica is a Japanese three-piece pop rock band under record labels Tower Records and Sacra Music (2018–), affiliated with the entertainment office Sony Music Artists.

__Biography:__
The band initially formed and began activities in 2013 under the name Snowman. Originally the band only consisted of childhood friends Yuuji and Masuda, but they were later joined by the vocalist Mikiha, who had initially heard of the band after they announced they were looking for a female vocalist.

On January 6, 2018, the band announced they would change their band name from Snowman to Spira Spica, which they have used since.

__Members:__
- [Mikiha](https://anilist.co/staff/169459) (幹葉) – vocalist, in-charge of lyrics
- Yuuji Teranishi (寺西裕二) – guitarist
- Masuda (ますだ) – bassist

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kemu8888)**

**Horie Shouta** is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger, bassist, pianoist and member of the five-piece rock band [PENGUIN RESEARCH](https://anilist.co/staff/120093).

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kemu8888)**

**Horie Shouta** is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger, bassist, pianoist and member of the five-piece rock band [PENGUIN RESEARCH](https://anilist.co/staff/120093).

__Genres:__ Rock (Alternative Rock), Anison

__[Website](http://www.penguinresearch.jp/) | [Profile (SonyMusic)](http://www.sonymusic.co.jp/artist/penguinresearch/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZPSPAvxS6Kb_gLe_HYi94g)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/PGR_info)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/4jiOvoNgxnEvdlBwrx6o28)__

__Biography:__
PENGUIN RESEARCH, alternatively abbreviated PGR, is a Japanese five-piece rock band under record labels ultraCeep (2016–), SME Records (2016–) and Sacra Music (2017–). They made their major debut in 2016 with the release of their first full single titled "[Joker ni Yoroshiku](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SnoDBlVBLh4)", which initially aired as an ending in [Durararax2 Ketsu](https://anilist.co/anime/20880/Durararax2-Ketsu/).

__Members:__
- [Youji Ikuta](https://anilist.co/staff/153560/) (生田鷹司) – vocalist
- [Shouta Horie](https://anilist.co/staff/156564) (堀江晶太) – bass guitarist and in-charge of lyrics and composition
- [John Kanda](https://anilist.co/staff/160031) (神田ジョン) – guitarist
- [Keita Shinbo](https://twitter.com/KeitaShinbo_PGR) (新保恵大) – drummer
- [Yosuke Shibazaki](https://twitter.com/yosuke_pgr) (柴﨑洋輔) – keyboardist

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/watanabesho)__ | __[Blog (jp)](https://ameblo.jp/shoooou/)__ | __[Artist Profile (Smile Company)](https://www.smile-co.jp/archives/creator/431)__

Shou Watanabe is a Japanese keyboardist, lyricist, composer, arranger and member of three-piece rock band [Sajou no Hana](https://anilist.co/staff/137163/).

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kemu8888)**

**Horie Shouta** is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger, bassist, pianoist and member of the five-piece rock band [PENGUIN RESEARCH](https://anilist.co/staff/120093).
__Itsuki__ is a Japanese lyricist.
__If I__ is an arranger.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mkh0614) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kanbajyanaiyo/)__

__Mikiha__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist and member of the band [Spira Spica](https://anilist.co/staff/140231/Spira-Spica).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/humikane)

The original designer behind the popular mecha musume genre (now trademarked by Fumikane), he takes combinations of bishoujo and war machines and made it his well-recognized art form. So far, besides Mecha Musume, he has designed toy designs for Busou Shinki toy line by Konami, and the popular anime series Sky Girls and Strike Witches, the former also from Konami.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/megi_sin)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/KANETAKE)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ippikihitsuji)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/harapand)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ippeigyoubu)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/135414143)

Junya Ishigaki is a Japanese mechanical designer. His debut was as a guest mechanical designer on [Yuusha Exkaiser](https://anilist.co/anime/3325/Brave-Exkaiser/) in 1990 for Sunrise, where he worked for the next few years before going freelance. In 1998 he was one of the founders of the small short-lived Studio Trapezoid together with [Manabu Ono](https://anilist.co/staff/102190/Manabu-Ono), [Susumu Yamaguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/109727/Susumu-Yamaguchi) and [Takuya Saitou](https://anilist.co/staff/144019/Takuya-Saitou).

__Notable works outside anime:__

- Xenogears (Video Game, 1998) (Main Mechanical Design)
- Xenosaga: Episode I - Der Wille zur Macht (Video Game, 2002) (Mechanical Design, Production Designer)
- Xenosaga: Episode II - Jenseits von Gut und Böse (Video Game, 2004) (Mechanical Designer, Production Designer)
- Xenosaga: Episode III - Also Sprach Zarathustra (Video Game, 2006) (Production Designer)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/163654019)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/151679259) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=1304769)

A freelance designer. He hasn't been active as an animator in over a decade.

Originating from [Tatsunoko Production](https://anilist.co/studio/103/).
Kunio Okawara was the first in the industry to be specifically credited as a mechanical designer. He is the designer of numerous Real Robots and Super Robots.
